Text: To find a subset of an array whose sum is
Label: code

Text: equal to a specified number.
Label: code

Text: Using Backtracking Approach.
Label: code

Text: Time Complexity: - Worst case O(2^n)
Label: code

Text: Space Complecity: - O(1)
Label: code

Text: #include <bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: // BACKTRACKING ALGORITHM
Label: code

Text: void subsetsum(int Set[], int pos, int sum, int tmpsum, int size, bool & found)
Label: code

Text: if (sum == tmpsum)
Label: code

Text: found=true;;
Label: code

Text: // generate nodes along the breadth
Label: code

Text: for (int i = pos; i < size; i++)
Label: code

Text: if (tmpsum + Set[i] <= sum)
Label: code

Text: tmpsum += Set[i];
Label: code

Text: // consider next level node (along depth)
Label: code

Text: subsetsum(Set, i + 1, sum, tmpsum, size, found);
Label: code

Text: tmpsum -= Set[i];
Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Text: cout << "Enter the value of sum" << endl;
Label: code

Text: cin >> sum;
Label: code

Text: subsetsum(a, 0, sum, 0, n, found);

Label: code

Label: code

Text: // Program to print path from root node to destination node
Label: code

Text: // for N*N -1 puzzle algorithm using Branch and Bound
Label: code

Text: // The solution assumes that instance of puzzle is solvable
Label: code

Text: #include <bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: #define N 3
Label: code

Text: // state space tree nodes
Label: code

Text: struct Node
Label: code

Text: // stores the parent node of the current node
Label: code

Text: // helps in tracing path when the answer is found
Label: code

Text: Node* parent;
Label: code

Text: // stores matrix
Label: code

Text: int mat[N][N];
Label: code

Text: // stores blank tile coordinates
Label: code

Text: int x, y;
Label: code

Text: // stores the number of misplaced tiles
Label: code

Text: int cost;
Label: code

Text: // stores the number of moves so far
Label: code

Text: int level;
Label: code

Text: // Function to print N x N matrix
Label: code

Text: int printMatrix(int mat[N][N])
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < N; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 0; j < N; j++)
Label: code

Text: printf("%d ", mat[i][j]);
Label: code

Text: printf("\n");
Label: code

Text: // Function to allocate a new node
Label: code

Text: Node* newNode(int mat[N][N], int x, int y, int newX,
Label: code

Text: int newY, int level, Node* parent)
Label: code

Text: Node* node = new Node;
Label: code

Text: // set pointer for path to root
Label: code

Text: node->parent = parent;
Label: code

Text: // copy data from parent node to current node
Label: code

Text: memcpy(node->mat, mat, sizeof node->mat);
Label: code

Text: // move tile by 1 position
Label: code

Text: swap(node->mat[x][y], node->mat[newX][newY]);
Label: code

Text: // set number of misplaced tiles
Label: code

Text: node->cost = INT_MAX;
Label: code

Text: // set number of moves so far
Label: code

Text: node->level = level;
Label: code

Text: // update new blank tile cordinates
Label: code

Text: node->x = newX;
Label: code

Text: node->y = newY;
Label: code

Text: return node;
Label: code

Text: // bottom, left, top, right
Label: code

Text: // Function to calculate the number of misplaced tiles
Label: code

Text: // ie. number of non-blank tiles not in their goal position
Label: code

Text: int calculateCost(int initial[N][N], int final[N][N])
Label: code

Text: int count = 0;
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < N; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 0; j < N; j++)
Label: code

Text: if (initial[i][j] && initial[i][j] != final[i][j])
Label: code

Text: count++;
Label: code

Text: return count;
Label: code

Text: // Function to check if (x, y) is a valid matrix cordinate
Label: code

Text: int isSafe(int x, int y)
Label: code

Text: return (x >= 0 && x < N && y >= 0 && y < N);
Label: code

Text: // print path from root node to destination node
Label: code

Text: void printPath(Node* root)
Label: code

Text: if (root == NULL)
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: printPath(root->parent);
Label: code

Text: printMatrix(root->mat);
Label: code

Text: printf("\n");
Label: code

Text: // Comparison object to be used to order the heap
Label: code

Text: struct comp
Label: code

Text: bool operator()(const Node* lhs, const Node* rhs) const
Label: code

Text: return (lhs->cost + lhs->level) > (rhs->cost + rhs->level);
Label: code

Text: // Function to solve N*N - 1 puzzle algorithm using
Label: code

Text: // Branch and Bound. x and y are blank tile coordinates
Label: code

Text: // in initial state
Label: code

Text: void solve(int initial[N][N], int x, int y,
Label: code

Text: int final[N][N])
Label: code

Text: // Create a priority queue to store live nodes of
Label: code

Text: // search tree;
Label: code

Text: priority_queue<Node*, std::vector<Node*>, comp> pq;
Label: code

Text: // create a root node and calculate its cost
Label: code

Text: Node* root = newNode(initial, x, y, x, y, 0, NULL);
Label: code

Text: root->cost = calculateCost(initial, final);
Label: code

Text: // Add root to list of live nodes;
Label: code

Text: pq.push(root);
Label: code

Text: // Finds a live node with least cost,
Label: code

Text: // add its childrens to list of live nodes and
Label: code

Text: // finally deletes it from the list.
Label: code

Text: while (!pq.empty())
Label: code

Text: // Find a live node with least estimated cost
Label: code

Text: Node* min = pq.top();
Label: code

Text: // The found node is deleted from the list of
Label: code

Text: // live nodes
Label: code

Text: pq.pop();
Label: code

Text: // if min is an answer node
Label: code

Text: if (min->cost == 0)
Label: code

Text: // print the path from root to destination;
Label: code

Text: printPath(min);
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: // do for each child of min
Label: code

Text: // max 4 children for a node
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
Label: code

Text: if (isSafe(min->x + row[i], min->y + col[i]))
Label: code

Text: // create a child node and calculate
Label: code

Text: // its cost
Label: code

Text: Node* child = newNode(min->mat, min->x,
Label: code

Text: min->y, min->x + row[i],
Label: code

Text: min->y + col[i],
Label: code

Text: min->level + 1, min);
Label: code

Text: child->cost = calculateCost(child->mat, final);
Label: code

Text: // Add child to list of live nodes
Label: code

Text: pq.push(child);
Label: code

Text: Title:Tiling Problem using Divide and Conquer algorithm.
Label: code

Text: Description: Given a n x n board where n is of form 2^k where k >= 1.The board has one missing cell (of size 1 x 1).
Label: code

Text: Expected Result: To fill the board using L shaped tiles of size(2x2) with one cell of size 11 missing.
Label: code

Text: #include <bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: int grid_size, b=0, a=0, cnt = 0;
Label: code

Text: // Placing tile at the specified position
Label: code

Text: void place_tile(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3)
Label: code

Text: cnt++;
Label: code

Text: arr[x1][y1] = cnt;
Label: code

Text: arr[x2][y2] = cnt;
Label: code

Text: arr[x3][y3] = cnt;
Label: code

Text: // Divide and Conquer Method
Label: code

Text: int tile(int n, int x, int y)
Label: code

Text: int pos1,pos2;
Label: code

Text: //if grid size =2x2, the grid can be filled with a single tile
Label: code

Text: cnt++;
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < n; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 0; j < n; j++)
Label: code

Text: if (arr[x + i][y + j] == 0)
Label: code

Text: arr[x + i][y + j] = cnt;
Label: code

Text: return 0;
Label: code

Text: /* Identifying the missing tile location*/
Label: code

Text: for (int i = x; i < n; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = y; j < n; j++)
Label: code

Text: if (arr[i][j] != 0)
Label: code

Text: pos1 = i, pos2 = j;
Label: code

Text: /*A L shaped tile at the center such that it does not cover the n/2 * n/2 subsquare that has a missing square. Now all four subsquares of size n/2 x n/2 have a missing cell*/
Label: code

Text: // If missing tile exists in first quadrant
Label: code

Text: if (pos1 < x + n / 2 && pos2 < y + n / 2)
Label: code

Text: // If missing Tile exists in 2st quadrant
Label: code

Text: if (pos1 >= x + n / 2 && pos2 < y + n / 2)
Label: code

Text: // If missing Tile exists in 3st quadrant
Label: code

Text: if (pos1 < x + n / 2 && pos2 >= y + n / 2)
Label: code

Text: // If missing Tile exists in 4st quadrant
Label: code

Text: if (pos1 >= x + n / 2 && pos2 >= y + n / 2)
Label: code

Text: /*recursively subdividing the problems into subquarters*/
Label: code

Text: tile(n / 2, x, y + n / 2);
Label: code

Text: tile(n / 2, x, y);
Label: code

Text: tile(n / 2, x + n / 2, y);
Label: code

Text: tile(n / 2, x + n / 2, y + n / 2);
Label: code

Text: return 0;
Label: code

Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < grid_size; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 0; j < grid_size; j++)
Label: code

Text: cout << arr[i][j] << " \t";
Label: code

Text: cout << "\n";
Label: code

Text: int main()
Label: code

Text: cin>>grid_size;
Label: code

Text: /*Block the tiles*/
Label: code

Text: tile(grid_size, 0, 0);
Label: code

Text: print_grid();
Label: code

Text: Title - Knapsack Problem solution in C++
Label: code

Text: Given weights and values of n items, put  these items in a knapsack of capacity W to get the maximum total value in the knapsack.
Label: code

Text: Remember you can only take an items atmost once.
Label: code

Text: INPUT FORMAT
Label: code

Text: First line will have n and W the number of items, and the maximum weight the knapsack can hold.
Label: code

Text: Second line will have n integers w1, w2, ... wn where wi is the weight of the i-th item
Label: code

Text: Third line will have n integers V1, V2, ... Vn where Vi is the value of the i-th item
Label: code

Text: OUTPUT FORMAT
Label: code

Text: A single integer value which is the maximum value that can be stored in a knapsack
Label: code

Text: CONSTRAINTS (Set -1)
Label: code

Text: 0<wi<=W
Label: code

Text: NOTE:
Label: code

Text: You cannot divide a item, like take a part of the item, you can either take the whole item or you can't. Since there is just two options we call this 0-1 knapsack.
Label: code

Text: #include<bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: int main(){
Label: code

Text: long long n, w;
Label: code

Text: cin>>n>>w;
Label: code

Text: vector<long long> val(n), wt(n);
Label: code

Text: for(int i=0; i<n; i++){
Label: code

Text: cin>>wt[i];
Label: code

Text: for(int i=0; i<n; i++){
Label: code

Text: cin>>val[i];
Label: code

Text: vector<vector<long long>> dp(n+1, vector<long long>(w+1, 0));
Label: code

Text: for(int index=0; index<=n; index++){
Label: code

Text: for(int wtSoFar=0; wtSoFar<=w; wtSoFar++){
Label: code

Text: if(index==0 || wtSoFar==0){
Label: code

Text: dp[index][wtSoFar]=0;
Label: code

Text: }else if(wt[index-1]<=wtSoFar){
Label: code

Text: dp[index][wtSoFar] = max(dp[index-1][wtSoFar], dp[index-1][wtSoFar-wt[index-1]]+val[index-1]);
Label: code

Text: }else{
Label: code

Text: dp[index][wtSoFar] = dp[index-1][wtSoFar];
Label: code

Text: cout<<dp[n][w];
Label: code

Text: return 0;
Label: code

Text: SAMPLE TEST CASE 1:
Label: code

Text: INPUT
Label: code

Text: OUTPUT
Label: code

Text: SAMPLE TEST CASE 2:
Label: code

Text: INPUT
Label: code

Text: OUTPUT
Label: code

Text: EXPLANATION:
Label: code

Text: Clearly we can see, we have two choices for every item. Either consider it or don't consider it. So if we consider all the items we will have 2^n choices.
Label: code

Text: Now if we use the bruteforce it will exponential, so we will use DP. Our dp array is n*w which is within the memory bounds. Also the runtime is O(n*W) which is quite optimal.
Label: code

Text: Dp states:
Label: code

Text: 1. Index of Item
Label: code

Text: 2. Current Weight.
Label: code

Text: DP Value:
Label: code

Text: Stores the maximum value of items, if we consider 'index' number of items and 'wtSoFar' amount of max weight
Label: code

Text: let's say we are at the i-th index. We can either take this item. or we can't
Label: code

Text: CASE 1: We take the item
Label: code

Text: Then the value will dp[index-1][wtSoFar-wt[index-1]]+val[index-1];
Label: code

Text: We are doing index-1 becz our weight and value arrays are 1-based indexing
Label: code

Text: CASE 2: We don't take this item
Label: code

Text: Then the value will be dp[index-1][wtSoFar]
Label: code

Text: So, which value to assign. simply MAX(CASE1, CASE2)
Label: code

Text: Title - Longest Increasing Subsequence.
Label: code

Text: Given an array it will find the length of the longest subsequence in that array
Label: code

Text: which is strictly increasing.
Label: code

Text: This algo can be modified to stor that same subsequence.
Label: code

Text: This algorithm uses Dynamic Programming to find the LIS.
Label: code

Text: Complexity - O(n*n)
Label: code

Text: #include<bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: Below lis function calculate the LIS for given input array as parameter.
Label: code

Text: This uses a bottom up approach for finding LIS ending at each element.
Label: code

Text: Algorithm:
Label: code

Text: 1. Initialize an array of length n, which stores the length of max LIS possible till a given index i (incusive).
Label: code

Text: 2. For each index, minimum possible LIS is 1 (formed bhy it's own element)
Label: code

Text: 3. For each index, check for all elemnts smaller than current and present on left side. Max LIS is possible by inclusion of any of these.
Label: code

Text: int lis( int arr[], int n )
Label: code

Text: // dp array, here max increasing subsequence, possible till a given index, inclusive of that index.
Label: code

Text: int dp[n];
Label: code

Text: // First element can have LIS of 1 only.
Label: code

Text: /* Compute optimized LIS values in
Label: code

Text: bottom up manner */
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 1; i < n; i++ )
Label: code

Text: //initialize with min possible LIS i.e. 1
Label: code

Text: // Check for LIS till all elements smaller than arr[i] and present on left side.
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 0; j < i; j++ )
Label: code

Text: if ( arr[i] > arr[j] && dp[i] < dp[j] + 1)
Label: code

Text: dp[i] = dp[j] + 1;
Label: code

Text: // Return maximum value in dp[] array.
Label: code

Text: return *max_element(dp, dp+n);
Label: code

Label: code

Text: int n;
Label: code

Text: cin>>n;
Label: code

Text: int arr[n];
Label: code

Text: for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
Label: code

Text: cin>>arr[i];
Label: code

Text: // Title - Longest Palindromic Subsequence
Label: code

Text: // Statement - It will find the length of the Longest Palindromic Subsequence in a string
Label: code

Text: // Time complexity - O(n^2)
Label: code

Text: #include<bits/stdc++.h>
Label: code

Text: using namespace std;
Label: code

Text: // Returns the length of the longest palindromic subsequence in given string
Label: code

Text: int lps(string &str)
Label: code

Text: int n = str.length();
Label: code

Text: int i, j, cl;
Label: code

Text: int L[n][n];  // Table to store results of subproblems
Label: code

Text: // Strings of length 1 are palindrome of length 1
Label: code

Text: for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
Label: code

Text: // Iterate through substrings of length 2 to n
Label: code

Text: for (cl=2; cl<=n; cl++)
Label: code

Text: for (i=0; i<n-cl+1; i++)
Label: code

Text: j = i+cl-1;
Label: code

Text: public static void BubbleSort(int[] array)

Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Text: Utility.Swap(array, i, i + 1);
Label: code

Text: public static void SelectionSort(int[] array)
Label: code

Text: for (int partIndex = array.Length - 1; partIndex > 0; partIndex--)
Label: code

Text: int largestAt = 0;
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 1; i <= partIndex; i++)
Label: code

Text: if (array[i] > array[largestAt])
Label: code

Text: largestAt = i;
Label: code

Text: Utility.Swap(array, largestAt, partIndex);
Label: code

Text: public static void InsertionSort(int[] array)
Label: code

Text: for (int partIndex = 1; partIndex < array.Length; partIndex++)
Label: code

Text: int curUnsorted = array[partIndex];
Label: code

Text: int i = 0;
Label: code

Text: for (i = partIndex; i > 0 && array[i - 1] > curUnsorted; i--)
Label: code

Text: array[i] = array[i - 1];
Label: code

Text: array[i] = curUnsorted;
Label: code

Text: public static void ShellSort(int[] array)
Label: code

Text: int gap = 1;
Label: code

Text: while (gap < array.Length / 3)
Label: code

Text: gap = 3 * gap + 1;
Label: code

Text: while (gap >= 1)
Label: code

Text: for (int i = gap; i < array.Length; i++)
Label: code

Text: for (int j = i; j >= gap && array[j] < array[j - gap]; j -= gap)
Label: code

Text: Utility.Swap(array, j, j - gap);
Label: code

Text: gap /= 3;
Label: code

Text: //C# 7 allows for local functions

Text: public static void MergeSort(int[] array)
Label: code

Text: int[] aux = new int[array.Length];
Label: code

Text: Sort(0, array.Length - 1);
Label: code

Text: void Sort(int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: if (high <= low)
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: //Right sub arrays will be bigger
Label: code

Text: int mid = (high + low) / 2;
Label: code

Text: Sort(low, mid);
Label: code

Text: Sort(mid + 1, high);
Label: code

Text: Merge(low, mid, high);
Label: code

Text: void Merge(int low, int mid, int high)
Label: code

Text: if (array[mid] <= array[mid + 1])
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: int i = low;
Label: code

Text: int j = mid + 1;
Label: code

Text: Array.Copy(array, low, aux, low, high - low + 1);
Label: code

Text: for (int k = low; k <= high; k++)
Label: code

Text: if (i > mid)
Label: code

Text: array[k] = aux[j++];
Label: code

Text: else if (j > high)
Label: code

Text: array[k] = aux[i++];
Label: code

Text: else if (aux[j] < aux[i])
Label: code

Text: array[k] = aux[j++];
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: array[k] = aux[i++];
Label: code

Text: public static void QuickSort(int[] array)
Label: code

Text: Sort(0, array.Length - 1);
Label: code

Text: void Sort(int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: if (high <= low)
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: int j = Partition(low, high);
Label: code

Text: Sort(low, j - 1);
Label: code

Text: Sort(j + 1, high);
Label: code

Text: int Partition(int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: int i = low;
Label: code

Text: int j = high + 1;
Label: code

Text: int pivot = array[low];
Label: code

Text: while (true)
Label: code

Text: while (array[++i] < pivot)
Label: code

Text: if (i == high)
Label: code

Text: break;
Label: code

Text: while (pivot < array[--j])
Label: code

Text: if (j == low)
Label: code

Text: break;
Label: code

Text: if (i >= j)
Label: code

Text: break;
Label: code

Text: Utility.Swap(array, i, j);
Label: code

Text: Utility.Swap(array, low, j);
Label: code

Text: return j;
Label: code

Text: public ChainHashSet(int capacity)
Label: code

Text: Capacity = capacity;
Label: code

Text: _chains = new SequentialSearchSt<TKey, TValue>[capacity];
Label: code

Text: for(int i=0; i<capacity; i++)
Label: code

Text: _chains[i] = new SequentialSearchSt<TKey, TValue>();
Label: code

Text: private int Hash(TKey key)
Label: code

Text: return (key.GetHashCode() & 0x7fffffff) % Capacity;
Label: code

Text: public TValue Get(TKey key)
Label: code

Text: if (key == null)
Label: code

Text: throw new ArgumentNullException(paramName: "Key is not allowed to be null");
Label: code

Text: int index = Hash(key);
Label: code

Text: if (_chains[index].TryGet(key, out TValue val))
Label: code

Text: return val;
Label: code

Text: throw new ArgumentException(message: "Key was not found");
Label: code

Text: public bool Contains(TKey key)
Label: code

Text: if (key == null)
Label: code

Text: throw new ArgumentNullException(paramName: "Key is not allowed to be null");
Label: code

Text: int index = Hash(key);
Label: code

Text: return _chains[index].TryGet(key, out TValue _);
Label: code

Text: public bool Remove(TKey key)
Label: code

Text: if(key == null)
Label: code

Text: throw new ArgumentNullException(paramName: "Key is not allowed to be null");
Label: code

Text: int index = Hash(key);
Label: code

Text: if (_chains[index].Contains(key))
Label: code

Text: Count--;
Label: code

Text: _chains[index].Remove(key);
Label: code

Text: return true;
Label: code

Text: return false;
Label: code

Text: public void Add(TKey key, TValue val)
Label: code

Text: if (key == null)
Label: code

Text: throw new ArgumentNullException(paramName: "Key is not allowed to be null");
Label: code

Text: if(val == null)
Label: code

Text: Remove(key);
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: if (Count >= 10 * Capacity) Resize(2 * Capacity);
Label: code

Text: int i = Hash(key);
Label: code

Text: if (!_chains[i].Contains(key))
Label: code

Text: Count++;
Label: code

Text: _chains[i].Add(key, val);
Label: code

Text: private void Resize(int chains)
Label: code

Text: var temp = new ChainHashSet<TKey, TValue>(chains);
Label: code

Text: for(int i=0; i<Capacity; i++)
Label: code

Text: foreach(var key in _chains[i].Keys())
Label: code

Text: if(_chains[i].TryGet(key, out TValue val))
Label: code

Text: temp.Add(key, val);
Label: code

Text: Capacity = temp.Capacity;
Label: code

Text: Count = temp.Count;
Label: code

Text: _chains = temp._chains;
Label: code

Text: class DoubleLinkedList<T>

Text: public DoublyLinkedNode<T> Head { get;  set; }
Label: code

Text: public DoublyLinkedNode<T> Tail { get;  set; }
Label: code

Text: public int Count { get; private set; }
Label: code

Text: public bool IsEmpty => Count == 0;
Label: code

Text: public void AddFirst(T value)
Label: code

Text: AddFirst(new DoublyLinkedNode<T>(value));
Label: code

Text: public void AddLast(T value)
Label: code

Text: AddLast(new DoublyLinkedNode<T>(value));
Label: code

Text: public void RemoveFirst()
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: throw new InvalidOperationException();
Label: code

Text: //Shift the head node
Label: code

Text: Head = Head.Next;
Label: code

Text: Count--;
Label: code

Text: if(IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: Tail = null;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: Head.Previous = null;
Label: code

Text: public void RemoveLast()
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: throw new InvalidOperationException();
Label: code

Text: if(Count == 1)
Label: code

Text: Head = null;
Label: code

Text: Tail = null;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: Tail.Previous.Next = null;  //null the last node
Label: code

Text: Tail = Tail.Previous;       //shift the tail (now it is the former penultimate node)
Label: code

Text: Count--;
Label: code

Text: private void AddFirst(DoublyLinkedNode<T> node)
Label: code

Text: //Save off the head
Label: code

Text: DoublyLinkedNode<T> temp = Head;
Label: code

Text: //Point head to node
Label: code

Text: Head = node;
Label: code

Text: //Insert the rest of the list behind the head
Label: code

Text: Head.Next = temp;
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: Tail = Head;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: temp.Previous = Head;
Label: code

Text: Count++;
Label: code

Text: private void AddLast(DoublyLinkedNode<T> node)
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: Head = node;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: Tail.Next = node;
Label: code

Text: node.Previous = Tail;
Label: code

Text: Tail = node;
Label: code

Text: Count++;
Label: code

Text: int InternalRecursiveBinarySearch(int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: if(low >= high)
Label: code

Text: return -1;
Label: code

Text: int mid = (low + high) / 2;
Label: code

Text: if(array[mid] == value)
Label: code

Text: return mid;
Label: code

Text: if(array[mid] < value)
Label: code

Text: return InternalRecursiveBinarySearch(mid + 1, high);
Label: code

Text: return InternalRecursiveBinarySearch(low, mid);

Label: code

Text: return mid;
Label: code

Text: if(array[mid] < value)
Label: code

Text: low = mid + 1;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: high = mid;
Label: code

Text: return -1;

Label: code

Text: public Node<T> Head { get; private set; }
Label: code

Text: public Node<T> Tail { get; private set; }
Label: code

Text: public int Count { get; private set; }
Label: code

Text: public bool IsEmpty => Count == 0;

Text: public void AddFirst(T value)
Label: code

Text: AddFirst(new Node<T>(value));
Label: code

Text: public void AddLast(T value)
Label: code

Text: public void RemoveFirst()
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: throw new InvalidOperationException();
Label: code

Text: Head = Head.Next;
Label: code

Text: if (Count == 1)
Label: code

Text: Tail = null;
Label: code

Text: Count--;
Label: code

Text: public void RemoveLast()
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: throw new InvalidOperationException();
Label: code

Text: if (Count == 1)
Label: code

Text: Head = Tail = null;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: //find the penultimate node
Label: code

Text: var current = Head;
Label: code

Text: while(current.Next != Tail)
Label: code

Text: current = current.Next;
Label: code

Text: current.Next = null;
Label: code

Text: Tail = current;
Label: code

Text: Count--;
Label: code

Text: private void AddFirst(Node<T> node)
Label: code

Text: //save off the current head
Label: code

Text: Node<T> tmp = Head;
Label: code

Text: Head = node;
Label: code

Text: //Shifting the former head
Label: code

Text: Head.Next = tmp;
Label: code

Text: Count++;
Label: code

Text: if(Count == 1)
Label: code

Text: Tail = Head;
Label: code

Text: private void AddLast(Node<T> node)
Label: code

Text: if (IsEmpty)
Label: code

Text: Head = node;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: Tail.Next = node;
Label: code

Text: Tail = node;
Label: code

Text: Count++;

Label: code

Text: // step by taking 1 step
Label: code

Text: dp[i] = dp[i - 1] + dp[i - 2];
Label: code

Text: return dp[n];

Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Text: continue;
Label: code

Text: min = Math.min(min, dp[i - coins[j]]); // finding minimum number of coins to make up amount = i
Label: code

Text: if (min == Integer.MAX_VALUE || min == 100000) // if we cannnot make amount = i then we mark it as invalid
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: dp[i] = min + 1; // else we add one coin to the min no of coins needed
Label: code

Text: return dp[target] == 100000 ? -1 : dp[target];

Label: code

Text: public class CombinationSum1 {
Label: code

Text: public static boolean solve(int target, int[] nums) {
Label: code

Text: boolean[][] dp = new boolean[nums.length + 1][target + 1];
Label: code

Text: // dp[i][j] represents , is it possible to select subset from nums till index i
Label: code

Text: // to make sum equal to j;
Label: code

Text: // first row represents the empty subset;
Label: code

Text: // we can make sum equal to 0 with empty subset;
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < nums.length; i++)
Label: code

Text: dp[i][0] = true;
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 1; i <= nums.length; i++) {
Label: code

Text: for (int j = 1; j <= target; j++) {
Label: code

Text: if (nums[i - 1] <= j) {
Label: code

Text: dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j] | dp[i - 1][j - nums[i - 1]]; // consideing both inclusive and exclusive
Label: code

Text: } else {
Label: code

Text: dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j];
Label: code

Text: return dp[nums.length][target];
Label: code

Text: public static void main(String[] args) {
Label: code

Text: int target = 10;
Label: code

Text: boolean ans = solve(target, nums);
Label: code

Text: System.out.println(ans);
Label: code

Text: * Implements the counting sort algorithm on an input array of integers.
Label: code

Text: * @param array - An array of integers to be sorted.
Label: code

Text: * @return An array of integers sorted in non-descending order.
Label: code

Text: * Time Complexity:
Label: code

Text: * - O(n + k), where n is the length of the input array and k is the range of values in the input array.
Label: code

Text: * Space Complexity:
Label: code

Text: * - O(k), where k is the range of values in the input array.
Label: code

Text: public static int[] countingSort(int[] array) {
Label: code

Text: // determine the maximum value in the input array
Label: code

Text: int max = Arrays.stream(array).max().orElse(0);
Label: code

Text: // initialize a count array of size max + 1 with all elements set to 0
Label: code

Text: int[] count = new int[max + 1];
Label: code

Text: // iterate over the input array and increment the count of each element's value
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
Label: code

Text: count[array[i]]++;
Label: code

Text: // modify the count array to reflect the number of elements <= each element's value
Label: code

Text: for (int i = 1; i <= max; i++) {
Label: code

Text: count[i] += count[i - 1];
Label: code

Text: // create a result array of size array.length with all elements set to 0
Label: code

Text: int[] result = new int[array.length];
Label: code

Text: // iterate over the input array backwards and place each element in its sorted position in the result array
Label: code

Text: for (int i = array.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
Label: code

Text: result[count[array[i]] - 1] = array[i];
Label: code

Text: count[array[i]]--;
Label: code

Text: // return the sorted result array
Label: code

Text: return result;
Label: code

Text: public static void mergeSort(int list[], int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: if (low >= high)
Label: code

Text: return;
Label: code

Text: int middle = (low + high) / 2;
Label: code

Text: mergeSort(list, low, middle);
Label: code

Label: code

Text: int IstList_end = middle;
Label: code

Label: code

Text: int l = low;
Label: code

Text: while ((l <= IstList_end) && (IIndList_start <= high))
Label: code

Text: if (list[low] < list[IIndList_start])
Label: code

Text: low++;
Label: code

Text: else
Label: code

Text: class QuickSort
Label: code

Text: // selects last element as pivot, pi using which array is partitioned.
Label: code

Text: int partition(int intArray[], int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: int pi = intArray[high];
Label: code

Text: int i = (low - 1); // smaller element index
Label: code

Text: for (int j = low; j < high; j++)
Label: code

Text: // check if current element is less than or equal to pi
Label: code

Text: if (intArray[j] <= pi)
Label: code

Text: // swap intArray[i] and intArray[j]
Label: code

Text: int temp = intArray[i];
Label: code

Text: intArray[i] = intArray[j];
Label: code

Text: intArray[j] = temp;
Label: code

Text: // swap intArray[i+1] and intArray[high] (or pi)
Label: code

Text: int temp = intArray[i + 1];
Label: code

Text: intArray[i + 1] = intArray[high];
Label: code

Text: intArray[high] = temp;
Label: code

Text: return i + 1;
Label: code

Text: // routine to sort the array partitions recursively
Label: code

Text: void quick_sort(int intArray[], int low, int high)
Label: code

Text: if (low < high)
Label: code

Text: // partition the array around pi=>partitioning index and return pi
Label: code

Text: int pi = partition(intArray, low, high);
Label: code

Text: // sort each partition recursively
Label: code

Text: quick_sort(intArray, low, pi - 1);
Label: code

Text: quick_sort(intArray, pi + 1, high);
Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Label: code

Text: distances.put(startingVertex.getData(), 0);
Label: code

Text: while(queue.size() != 0){
Label: code

Text: Vertex current = queue.poll().vertex;
Label: code

Text: for (Edge e: current.getEdges()) {
Label: code

Text: Integer alternate = distances.get(current.getData()) + e.getWeight();
Label: code

Text: String neighborValue = e.getEnd().getData();
Label: code

Text: if (alternate < distances.get(neighborValue)){
Label: code

Text: distances.put(neighborValue, alternate);
Label: code

Text: previous.put(neighborValue, current);
Label: code

Text: queue.add(new QueueObject(e.getEnd(), distances.get(neighborValue)));
Label: code

Text: return new Dictionary[]{distances, previous};
Label: code

Label: code

Text: # Title : Python3 Program to add two numbers without using arithmetic operator
Label: code

Text: def Add(a, b):
Label: code

Text: # Iterate till there is no carry
Label: code

Text: while b != 0:
Label: code

Text: # carry now contains common set bits of x and y
Label: code

Text: carry = a & b
Label: code

Text: # Sum of bits of x and y where at least one of the bits is not set
Label: code

Text: a = a ^ b
Label: code

Text: # Carry is shifted by one so that adding it to x gives the required sum
Label: code

Text: b = carry << 1
Label: code

Text: return a
Label: code

Text: LRU Cache Implementation :
Label: code

Text: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cache_replacement_policies#Least_recently_used_(LRU)
Label: code

Text: Extensively tested implementation for LRU (Least Recently Used)
Label: code

Text: Cache DS from scratch, without using any external library,
Label: code

Text: collection or container. This implementation uses a doubly
Label: code

Text: linked list and a simple hash-map.
Label: code

Text: class Node:
Label: code

Text:
"
Structure of a node in the doubly linked list
"
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self, key: int, data: int):
Label: code

Text: self.key = key
Label: code

Text: self.data = data
Label: code

Text: self.prev = None
Label: code

Text: self.next = None
Label: code

Text: class LRUCache:
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self, capacity: int):
Label: code

Text: self.hmap = {}  # key = int, value = Node
Label: code

Text: # Dummy Nodes
Label: code

Text: self.head = Node(None, None)
Label: code

Text: self.head.prev = None
Label: code

Text: self.tail = Node(None, None)
Label: code

Text: self.tail.next = None
Label: code

Text: self.head.next = self.tail
Label: code

Text: self.tail.prev = self.head
Label: code

Text: self.size = 0
Label: code

Text: self.capacity = capacity
Label: code

Text: def get(self, key: int) -> int:
Label: code

Text:
"
Access an item from the cache
"
Label: code

Text: if len(self.hmap) == 0 or key not in self.hmap:
Label: code

Text: return -1
Label: code

Text: this_node = self.hmap[key]
Label: code

Text: self.__moveToHead(this_node)
Label: code

Text: return this_node.data
Label: code

Text: def put(self, key: int, value: int) -> None:
Label: code

Text:
"
Add or Update an item in the cache
"
Label: code

Text: if key in self.hmap:
Label: code

Text: this_node = self.hmap[key]
Label: code

Text: this_node.data = value
Label: code

Text: self.__moveToHead(this_node)
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: new_node = Node(key, value)
Label: code

Text: self.hmap[key] = new_node
Label: code

Text: self.__addFirst(new_node)
Label: code

Text: self.size += 1
Label: code

Text: if self.size > self.capacity:
Label: code

Text: self.__removeLRUEntry()
Label: code

Text: def __removeLRUEntry(self):
Label: code

Text:
"
Evicts the least recently used item from cache
"
Label: code

Text: tail_node = self.__popTail()
Label: code

Text: del self.hmap[tail_node.key]
Label: code

Text: self.size -= 1
Label: code

Text: def __addFirst(self, node):
Label: code

Text:
"
Adds a node at the beginning of the linked list
"
Label: code

Text: node.prev = self.head
Label: code

Text: node.next = self.head.next
Label: code

Text: self.head.next.prev = node
Label: code

Text: self.head.next = node
Label: code

Text: def __removeNode(self, node):
Label: code

Text:
"
Removes a node from the doubly linked list
"
Label: code

Text: oldprev, oldnext = node.prev, node.next
Label: code

Text: oldprev.next = oldnext
Label: code

Text: oldnext.prev = oldprev
Label: code

Text: def __moveToHead(self, node):
Label: code

Text:
"
Removes the node and puts it at the beginning of the cache (list)
"
Label: code

Text: self.__removeNode(node)
Label: code

Text: self.__addFirst(node)
Label: code

Text: def __popTail(self):
Label: code

Text:
"
Removes and returns the element pointed by the tail of the list
"
Label: code

Text: rem = self.tail.prev
Label: code

Text: self.__removeNode(rem)
Label: code

Text: return rem
Label: code

Text: def display(self):
Label: code

Text:
"
Prints the elements in the cache in order
"
Label: code

Text: p = self.head.next
Label: code

Text: while p.next:
Label: code

Text: print("[Key:{0}, Value:{1}]".format(p.key, p.data), end=" ")
Label: code

Text: p = p.next
Label: code

Text: print("")
Label: code

Text: # Your LRUCache object will be instantiated and called as such:
Label: code

Text: # obj = LRUCache(capacity)
Label: code

Text: # param_1 = obj.get(key)
Label: code

Text: # obj.put(key,value)
Label: code

Text:
"
Simple implementation of unweighted and weighted Graphs.
Both are implemented using adjacency lists.
The weighted graph implementation stores the target edges of a single
starting node of the adjacency list using a list of tuples (index, weight).
Example:
>>> graph = WeightedGraph(5) # directed weighted graph
>>> graph.add_edge(0, 1, weight=4)
>>> graph.add_edge(0, 2, weight=3)
>>> graph.add_edge(2, 3, weight=1)
>>> graph.add_edge(3, 4, weight=5)
>>> graph.add_edge(4, 1, weight=2)
>>> print(graph)
0: 1 (weight: 4) 2 (weight: 3)
1:
2: 3 (weight: 1)
3: 4 (weight: 5)
4: 1 (weight: 2)
This example input is equivalent to:
>>> graph.edges = [
>>> [(1, 4), (2, 3)],
>>> [],
>>> [(3, 1)],
>>> [(4, 5)],
>>> [(1, 2)]
>>> ]
>>>
"
Label: code

Text: class UnweightedGraph:
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self, vertices, directed=True):
Label: code

Text: self.vertices = vertices
Label: code

Text: self.directed = directed
Label: code

Text: self.edges = [[] for _ in range(vertices)]
Label: code

Text: def __str__(self):
Label: code

Text: output = ""
Label: code

Text: for i in range(0, self.vertices):
Label: code

Text: output += f"{i}: "
Label: code

Text: for j in range(0, len(self.edges[i])):
Label: code

Text: output += f"{self.edges[i][j]} "
Label: code

Text: output += "\n"
Label: code

Text: return output
Label: code

Text: def has_vertex(self, vertex):
Label: code

Text: return 0 <= vertex < self.vertices
Label: code

Text: def has_edge(self, start, dest):
Label: code

Text: if self.has_vertex(start) and self.has_vertex(dest):
Label: code

Text: if dest in self.edges[start]:
Label: code

Text: return True
Label: code

Text: return False
Label: code

Text: def add_edge(self, start, dest):
Label: code

Text: if self.has_edge(start, dest):
Label: code

Text: return False
Label: code

Text: self.edges[start].append(dest)
Label: code

Text: if not self.directed:
Label: code

Text: self.edges[dest].append(start)
Label: code

Text: return True
Label: code

Text: class WeightedGraph:
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self, vertices, directed=True):
Label: code

Text: self.vertices = vertices
Label: code

Text: self.directed = directed
Label: code

Text: self.edges = [[] for _ in range(vertices)]
Label: code

Text: def __str__(self):
Label: code

Text: output = ""
Label: code

Text: for i in range(0, self.vertices):
Label: code

Text: output += f"{i}: "
Label: code

Text: for j in range(0, len(self.edges[i])):
Label: code

Text: output += f"{self.edges[i][j][0]} "
Label: code

Text: output += f"(weight: {self.edges[i][j][1]}) "
Label: code

Text: output += "\n"
Label: code

Text: return output
Label: code

Text: def has_vertex(self, vertex):
Label: code

Text: return 0 <= vertex < self.vertices
Label: code

Text: def has_edge(self, start, dest, weight):
Label: code

Text: if self.has_vertex(start) and self.has_vertex(dest):
Label: code

Text: if (dest, weight) in self.edges[start]:
Label: code

Text: return True
Label: code

Text: return False
Label: code

Text: def add_edge(self, start, dest, weight):
Label: code

Text: if self.has_edge(start, dest, weight):
Label: code

Text: return False
Label: code

Text: self.edges[start].append((dest, weight))
Label: code

Text: if not self.directed:
Label: code

Text: self.edges[dest].append((start, weight))
Label: code

Text: return True
Label: code

Text:
"
Heap
The heap is an important data structure. It provides the following
functionality:
findMin: Find the minimum of all the current data. O(1) runtime.
pop: Remove the minimum element from the current data and return it. O(log n)
runtime.
push: Add an element to the current data. O(log n) runtime.
The provided runtimes assume that the heap currently has n elements and that
checking less than on elements runs in O(1) time.
Implementation:
Our implementation of a heap will be done with arrays, and we will treat the
array as a binary tree. Each index, i, in the array will have a left and right
child" indicies at 2i + 1 and 2i + 2 respectively. The heap operates under the
Label: code

Text: assumption of an important invariant:
Label: code

Text: For all indicies i, the value at index i is less than the values at either of
Label: code

Text: its children (2i + 1 and 2i + 2).
Label: code

Text: When we want to findMin we just return the value at index 0 in the array, the
Label: code

Text: root of our tree. This must be the minimum due to the tree structure of the
Label: code

Text: heap, and the transittivity of less than.
Label: code

Text: When we add an element to the tree, we will add it to the end of the array,
Label: code

Text: lets say at index i. We can calculate its parent index, p = (i - 1) // 2 since
Label: code

Text: it will be either the left or right child of p. If the new value is less than
Label: code

Text: the value at p, we can swap the values at p and i. We dont have to check down
Label: code

Text: the other child of the parent, since less than is transitive.
Label: code

Text: We then bubble up, and check that the parent of p satisfies the invariant as
Label: code

Text: well, and we swap if it doesn't. At each step we half our index, so this
Label: code

Text: bubble-up-ing runs in O(log n) time.
Label: code

Text: When we remove the minimum from the heap, we record the current minimum to
Label: code

Text: return later, and then replace it with the last value in the array. Then we
Label: code

Text: perform another bubbling operation, but now in the opposite direction.
Label: code

Text: We find the index of the minimum value out of the node itself and its two
Label: code

Text: children. If the minimum is the node itself, we are done. If instead it is one
Label: code

Text: of the children, we swap the parent and minimum values, and keep bubbling down
Label: code

Text: from the child.
Label: code
code

Text: Bubbles the value arr[index] up to retain heap structure.
Label: code
code

Text: Bubbles the value arr[index] down to retain heap structure.
Label: code

Text:
"
n = len(arr)
while index < n:
# The index of the minimum value will be kept in extreme
extreme = index
left = index * 2 + 1
right = index * 2 + 2
if left < n and arr[left] < arr[extreme]:
extreme = left
if right < n and arr[right] < arr[extreme]:
extreme = right
if extreme == index:
break
arr[index], arr[extreme] = arr[extreme], arr[index]
index = extreme
def heapify(arr):
"
Label: code

Text: We can re-arrange any array to enforce the invariant.
Label: code
code

Text: Returns the minimum element in the heap.
Label: code
code

Text: return heap[0]
Label: code

Text: def heappop(heap):
Label: code

Text:
"
Removes the head element from heap, and then rearranges the result to
retain the heap invariant.
"
Label: code

Text: if len(heap) == 0:
Label: code

Text: raise IndexError("pop from empty heap")
Label: code

Text: if len(heap) == 1:
Label: code

Text: # We can return the only remaining value.
Label: code

Text: return heap.pop()
Label: code

Text: result = heap[0]
Label: code

Text: heap[0] = heap.pop()
Label: code

Text: __down(heap, 0)
Label: code

Text: return result
Label: code

Text: def heappush(heap, value):
Label: code

Text:
"
Adds a new element to the heap, then rearranges to retain the heap
invariant.
"
Label: code

Text: heap.append(value)
Label: code

Text: __up(heap, len(heap) - 1)
Label: code

Text: def heappushpop(heap, value):
Label: code

Text:
"
If we pop and push successively, we can simplify the process by only
bubbling once.
"
Label: code

Text: if len(heap) == 0:
Label: code

Text: raise IndexError("pop from empty heap")
Label: code

Text: result = heap[0]
Label: code

Text: heap[0] = value
Label: code

Text: __down(heap, 0)
Label: code

Text: return result
Label: code

Text: class Heap:
Label: code

Text:
"
This class is a wrapper for the individual methods implemented above.
It might help to realise you don't have to implement it with a class, you
can just implement it with an array and make sure to keep the heap
invariant.
"
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self):
Label: code

Text: self.__arr = []
Label: code

Text: def findMin(self):
Label: code

Text: return findMin(self.__arr)
Label: code

Text: def push(self, value):
Label: code

Text: heappush(self.__arr, value)
Label: code

Text: def pop(self):
Label: code

Text: return heappop(self.__arr)
Label: code

Text: def pushpop(self, value):
Label: code

Text: return heappushpop(self.__arr, value)
Label: code

Text: class PriorityQueue:
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self):
Label: code

Label: code

Text: # if you want you can set a maximum size for the queue
Label: code

Text: # O(n) insertion
Label: code

Text: # Inserts new Node into the priority queue in increasing order of priority
Label: code

Text: def insert(self, node):
Label: code

Text: # if queue is empty
Label: code

Text: if self.size() == 0:
Label: code

Text: # add the new node
Label: code

Text: self.queue.append(node)
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: # traverse the queue to find the right place for new node
Label: code

Text: for x in range(0, self.size()):
Label: code

Text: # if the priority of new node is greater
Label: code

Text: if node.priority >= self.queue[x].priority:
Label: code

Text: # if we have traversed the complete queue
Label: code

Text: if x == (self.size() - 1):
Label: code

Text: # add new node at the end
Label: code

Text: self.queue.insert(x + 1, node)
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: continue
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: self.queue.insert(x, node)
Label: code

Text: return True
Label: code

Text: # O(1) deletion
Label: code

Text: def delete(self):
Label: code

Text: # remove the first node from the queue
Label: code

Text: return self.queue.pop(0)
Label: code

Label: code

Text: def show(self):
Label: code

Text: for x in self.queue:
Label: code

Text: print(str(x.info) + " - " + str(x.priority))
Label: code

Label: code

Text: def size(self):
Label: code

Text: return len(self.queue)
Label: code

Text: class SegmentTree:
Label: code

Text:
"
Segment Tree data structure.
[wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Segment_tree)
Segment trees are useful for storing information about ranges (also called
segments) in a list of values.
The `leaves` argument is a list of values that will be queried.
The `accumulator` argument is a method that should compute some property of
a segment. In order for the segment tree to work as intended, `accumulator`
should take two inputs, and be commutative, and transitive. That is, for
fixed leaves `a`, `b` and `c`:
- Commutativity: `accumulator(a, b) == accumulator(b, a)`
- Transitivity: `accumulator(a, accumulator(b, c)) ==
accumulator(accumulator(a, b), c)`
Some common examples of an `accumulator` method are `sum`, `min`, and
`max`.
"
Label: code

Text: def __init__(self, leaves, accumulator):
Label: code

Text: self.__n = len(leaves)
Label: code

Text: self.acc = accumulator
Label: code

Text: # Now we build the tree.
Label: code

Text: self.tree = [None] * (self.__n * 4)
Label: code

Text: NEITHER_DONE = 0
Label: code

Text: LEFT_DONE = 1
Label: code

Text: BOTH_DONE = 2
Label: code

Text: stack = [(0, 0, self.__n, NEITHER_DONE)]
Label: code

Text: while stack:
Label: code

Text: print(stack)
Label: code

Text: treeIdx, l, r, state = stack.pop()
Label: code

Text: if l + 1 == r:
Label: code

Text: # leaf node
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx] = leaves[l]
Label: code

Text: elif state == NEITHER_DONE:
Label: code

Text: # We want to calculate the left subtree.
Label: code

Text: # Next time we see this node, the left subtree will be done.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx, l, r, LEFT_DONE))
Label: code

Text: # Push the left node to the stack.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 1, l, mid, NEITHER_DONE))
Label: code

Text: elif state == LEFT_DONE:
Label: code

Text: # We want to calculate the right subtree.
Label: code

Text: # Next time we see this node, both subtrees will be done.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx, l, r, BOTH_DONE))
Label: code

Text: # Push the right node to the stack.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 2, mid, r, NEITHER_DONE))
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx] = self.acc(
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx * 2 + 1],
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx * 2 + 2]
Label: code

Text: def query(self, start, end):
Label: code

Text:
"
Find the accumulated value over the range `leaves[start:end]` (includes
`leaves[i]` for `start <= i < end`).
"
Label: code

Text: # we want to accumulate all nodes whose range (nodeStart, nodeEnd)
Label: code

Text: # staisfies start ? nodeStart ? nodeEnd ? end
Label: code

Text: result = None
Label: code

Text: stack = [(0, 0, self.__n)]
Label: code

Text: while stack:
Label: code

Text: treeIdx, l, r = stack.pop()
Label: code

Text: if start <= l and r <= end:
Label: code

Text: # The entire node is contained in the query.
Label: code

Text: if result is None:
Label: code

Text: result = self.tree[treeIdx]
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: result = self.acc(result, self.tree[treeIdx])
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: if start < mid:
Label: code

Text: # At least some of the left subtree is contained in the
Label: code

Text: # query.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 1, l, mid))
Label: code

Text: if end > mid:
Label: code

Text: # At least some of the right subtree is contained in the
Label: code

Text: # query.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 2, mid, r))
Label: code

Text: return result
Label: code

Text: def update(self, i, value):
Label: code

Text:
"
Update the value in the `i`th leaf.
"
Label: code

Text: CHILD_NOT_DONE = 0
Label: code

Text: CHILD_DONE = 1
Label: code

Text: stack = [(0, 0, self.__n, CHILD_NOT_DONE)]
Label: code

Text: while stack:
Label: code

Text: treeIdx, l, r, state = stack.pop()
Label: code

Text: if l + 1 == r:
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx] = value
Label: code

Text: elif state == CHILD_NOT_DONE:
Label: code

Text: # we want to process the child that contains the node to be
Label: code

Text: # updated.
Label: code

Text: # Next time we see this node its child will be done.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx, l, r, CHILD_DONE))
Label: code

Text: # Which subtree is the target node in?
Label: code

Text: if i <= mid:
Label: code

Text: # It is in the left subtree.
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 1, l, mid, CHILD_NOT_DONE))
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: stack.append((treeIdx * 2 + 2, mid, r, CHILD_NOT_DONE))
Label: code

Text: else:
Label: code

Text: # Both children are now correct; one of them has been updated.
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx] = self.acc(
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx * 2 + 1],
Label: code

Text: self.tree[treeIdx * 2 + 2]

Text: Keberhasilan belajar murid tidak hanya bergantung pada jumlah dan mutu guru yang memadai
Label: text

Text: Namun, di sekolah yang jumlah dan mutu gurunya kurang, diduga potensi belajar murid akan sulit mencapai hasil maksimal
Label: text

Text: Tabel 5.2 memperlihatkan hubungan antara hasil tes murid dengan tingkat keabsenan guru
Label: text

Text: Secara umum terdapat kecenderungan bahwa murid yang memperoleh nilai rendah berasal dari sekolah yang gurunya lebih banyak absen
Label: text

Text: Dalam kaitan itu, banyak orang tua murid tidak mempunyai cukup kemampuan untuk menjelaskan proses penalaran tersebut
Label: text

Text: Tabel 5.3 memperlihatkan lebih jauh pentingnya faktor guru di sekolah bagi keberhasilan transformasi pengetahuan kepada murid
Label: text

Text: Masa kerja guru mempunyai korelasi positif dengan hasil tes matematika murid, tetapi tidak pada hasil tes bahasa
Label: text

Text: tetapi sampai batas tertentu, yaitu dengan rasio 25:1,
Label: text

Text: kenaikan angka rasionya mulai berkorelasi negatif terhadap nilai tes murid
Label: text

Text: Pekerjaan tambahan yang biasa dilakukan guru adalah mengajar di sekolah lain
Label: text

Text: Kegiatan seperti ini membuat guru lelah dan cenderung sering absen, akibatnya justru merusak mutu pendidikan di banyak sekolah
Label: text

Text: Guru yang ditempatkan di sekolah tertentu harus bekerja penuh waktu di sekolah tersebut
Label: text

Text: sementara latar belakang pendidikan bapak tidak berkorelasi secara signifikan dengan nilai tes anaknya
Label: text

Text: Secara umum bimbingan terhadap anak di rumah memang lebih banyak dilakukan oleh ibu
Label: text

Text: Sekolah yang memiliki lapangan bermain (olahraga) berkorelasi negatif dengan hasil tes murid

Text: Survei tentang fenomena keabsenan guru di Indonesia masih jarang dilakukan secara nasional
Label: text

Text: Survei ini dilakukan melalui dua kali kunjungan tanpa pemberitahuan ke sekolah sampel pada Oktober 2002 dan Maret 2003
Label: text

Text: Jika ada guru yang absen dan tidak ada penggantinya maka kegiatan belajar mengajar di kelas akan terganggu
Label: text

Text: Negara dengan tingkat keabsenan terendah adalah Peru, yaitu sebesar 11%

Text: Kedua, bahwa tahap perkembangan kemajuan wilayah tidak jelas pengaruhnya terhadap tingkat keabsenan guru

Text: Pulau Jawa sebagai wilayah yang paling berkembang di Indonesia diduga mempunyai keabsenan guru rendah, dalam realitasnya tidak

Label: text

Text: Absennya guru kontrak/honorer diduga kuat terkait dengan rendahnya penghasilan mereka

Text: Bersamaan dengan itu, bagi guru yang berpendidikan rendah harus disediakan tranining lebih lanjut

Text: Terdapat indikasi bahwa kelengkapan fasilitas fisik sekolah dapat mendukung kinerja guru

Text: Survei ini memperlihatkan adanya tingkat keabsenan guru yang rendah bila sekolah memiliki toilet

Text: Hal yang sama juga terjadi bila setiap tingkat kelas memiliki ruang belajarnya sendiri

Text: Indikasi ini menyiratkan bahwa pembangunan dan pemeliharaan gedung sama sekali tidak boleh diabaikan

Text: Hal terakhir ini mengindikasikan perlunya kehadiran petugas pengawas di lingkungan kerja guru

Label: text

Text: Pada dasarnya, guru melakukan pekerjaan tambahan karena adanya tuntutan kebutuhan untuk menambah penghasilan

Text: Dalam memutuskan pilihan lokasi tersebut, Kantor Pertanahan di tingkat kabupaten/kota umumnya menggunakan kebijakan/petunjuk BPN
